byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin reported from Kabul, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

abstract: Afghan Pres Hamid Karza's invitation to retired Gen Stanley A McChrystal, who led NATO troops in Afghanistan in 2009 and 2010, for a private visit may signal a return for McChrystal to the Afghan policy arena, where he was a significant player for the better part of a decade.
snippet: President Hamid Karzai has invited Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal to visit Afghanistan as the United States negotiates an agreement to chart the Afghan-American relationship after combat troops withdraw in 2014.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: President Hamid Karzai has invited Gen. Stanley A. McChrystal to visit Afghanistan as the United States negotiates an agreement to chart the Afghan-American relationship after combat troops withdraw in 2014.

headline.main: Afghan Leader’s Invitation Could Reopen Doors for Former U.S. Commander
headline.print_headline: Afghan Leader’s Invitation Could Reopen Doors for Former U.S. Commander
headline.seo: Karzai Invites McChrystal Back to Afghanistan for Visit
